Name: 'Odeh Muhammad Khalil al-Hazalin
Notes: Shot in the chest by a settler who opened fire at village residents who had gathered after an excavator worked their land, while al-Hazalin was filming him. The settler had earlier hit a resident with his handgun during an altercation bewteen him and residents. The excavator driver, who drove through one of the groves, hit another resident on the head with the excavator's hammer after at least one stone was thrown at the excavator's protective cage. Residents and activists carried al-Hazalin to the nearby settlement of Carmel. There, they encountered the settler who shot him, and he slapped al-Hazalin’s mother and knocked her to the ground. Al-Hazalin was taken by Israeli ambulance to Soroka Hospital, where he was pronounced dead. Israel held his body until 7 August 2025.

Name: Rabi' Muhammad Yusef Taqatqah
Notes: Shot by the settlement guard, according to the military after he threw stones and ran toward the settlement gate armed with a knife. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad Mahmoud al-Hur
Notes: Shot in the neck during a joint attack on the town by dozens of settlers and two soldiers, as he bent down to pick up a stone in an attempt to repel them. Earlier, settlers set fire to the town's fields. His brother, who threw stones at the shooting settler, was shot in the pelvis by a soldier and seriously injured. The two were evacuated to a clinic in Surif and from there to the government hospital in Hebron, where Muhammad was pronounced dead. During the attack, their 85-year-old father and another relative were injured by stones thrown by settlers, and a soldier kicked another brother in the face.

Name: Salah Mazen Kayed Yihya
Notes: Injured by shots fired by an Israeli civilian after stabbing and severely wounding another Israeli civilian who was standing with a group of people in front of a restaurant in the city. In video footage posted on social media, the armed civilian is seen kicking Yihya after he was shot and fell to the ground. Died of his wounds shortly after. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Hareth Khaled 'Abdallah Jbarah
Notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli citizen after running over Israelis at a bus stop near the settlement. The military claimed Jbarah lightly wounded two civilians and tried stabbing them after getting out of his car. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad Bassam Khalil Dardunah
Notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli citizen who pulled over after seeing Dardunah firing at passing vehicles, including his own. Dardunah had earlier shot and severely wounded a traffic police officer who had stopped at the scene. The officer died of his wounds shortly after. Four more Israelis were lightly and moderately injured as passing vehicles were shot. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad Rashed 'Aweidah Misk
Notes: Fatally shot by city patrol officers after shooting at passersby at a light rail station along with another Palestinian who stabbed passersby with a knife and was arrested after an Israeli citizen shot and seriously injured him. The two killed six Israeli citizens and a Georgian citizen and injured 11 others, six of them seriously. Misk was a Hamas military wing operative. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Zuhdi Nidal Tawfiq Abu 'Afifah
Notes: Fatally shot by a security patrolman in the settlement of Carmei Tzur after entering it in a car and, according to the military, trying to run over a security guard at the entrance and opening fire. According to the military, during the fire exchange, a bomb in his car exploded. Shortly before, a car caught fire at a nearby gas station after its Palestinian driver got out and was fatally shot when approaching Israeli armed forces. The military claimed the two worked together. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Rashid Mahmoud 'Abd al-Qader a-Sadah
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen by shots fired by settlers, who were attacking homes in the village, torching structures and cars and firing at Palestinian residents. Two more Palestinians were wounded in the attack, one by gunfire and one by a stone. A-Sada was evacuated to a house in the village and from there, he was taken in a car to the village entrance, where an ambulance was waiting to transport him to Rafidya Hospital in the city of Nablus. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Ghassan Hussein Gharib Zahran
Notes: Shot in the abdomen by members of a civilian emergency response team while throwing stones with other minors at Route 465 near the village. His body was found by local residents.

Name: Bilal 'Adel 'Abd al-Fatah Balalu
Notes: A man with a psychosocial disability. Fatally shot by the security guards of the Migdal Oz settlement, near the western entrance to the town. According to media reports, Balalu was spotted on security cameras as he approached the settlement. The security guards then approached him, and, according to the military, fired at him as he ran towards them with a knife drawn. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Maher Fares Bani Fadel
Notes: Shot in the chest by the settlers along with another Palestinian, after a settler invaded land belonging to farmers from ‘Aqraba with a herd of cattle, and was asked by residents of a nearby community to leave. The settler called soldiers and dozens of other settlers and a confrontation ensued, in which settlers attacked some of the community's residents with pepper spray, clubs and stones. When the residents tried to repel them with stones, settlers and soldiers opened fire and the two were critically wounded. According to the military, a preliminary investigation shows that the two were not hit by the soldiers’ fire. Israel held their bodies until 19 April 2024.

Name: Muhammad Ashraf Ghazi Bani Jame'
Notes: Shot in the chest by the settlers along with another Palestinian, after a settler invaded land belonging to farmers from ‘Aqraba with a herd of cattle, and was asked by residents of a nearby community to leave. The settler called soldiers and dozens of other settlers and a confrontation ensued, in which settlers attacked some of the community's residents with pepper spray, clubs and stones. When the residents tried to repel them with stones, settlers and soldiers opened fire and the two were critically wounded. According to the military, a preliminary investigation shows that the two were not hit by the soldiers’ fire. Israel held their bodies until 19 April 2024.

Name: 'Omar Ahmad Abd al-Ghani Hamed
Notes: Fatally shot by settlers who invaded the area and attacked village homes while searching for a teenager from an outpost who was stabbed to death by a Palestinian and whose body was found the next day. Hamed was shot shortly after arriving at the scene with others to repel the settlers. That day, the settlers attacked the village several times, setting fire to vehicles, vandalizing buildings and inflicting gunshot wounds on a teen.

Name: Ahmad Nayef Ahmad Nofal
Notes: Wounded from shots fired by a settler while riding in a car with two other young men who were wounded in the shooting. The settler claimed he heard a sound resembling gunfire from the direction of their car.

Name: Ibrahim Ahmad Mahmoud Wadi
Notes: Shot in the chest by settlers who were inside a car driving on Route 60 as he tried to escape them on a parallel road along with his father, who was also killed. The incident began when settlers, escorted by police, attacked the funeral procession of four Qusrah residents who were killed the day before, three of them, including one minor, in a settler attack and one by soldiers.

Name: Ahmad Ibrahim Ahmad Wadi
Notes: Shot in the chest by settlers who were inside a car driving on Route 60 as he tried to escape them on a parallel road along with his father, who was also killed. The incident began when settlers, escorted by police, attacked the funeral procession of four Qusrah residents who were killed the day before, three of them, including one minor, in a settler attack and one by soldiers.

Name: Mus'ab 'Abd al-Halim 'Aref Abu Ridi
Notes: Shot in the back by settlers during clashes that broke out after the settlers attacked a home in the village with stones. During the clashes, the settlers threw stones and fired live rounds at the residents, who threw stones in an attempt to repel them. Settlers killed two more Palestinians in the incident, including a minor, and wounded a father and his five-year-old daughter. In clashes that broke out in the village afterwards, soldiers killed another Palestinian. At least 11 more Palestinians were injured that day.

Name: Mu'ad Raed Mahmoud 'Odeh
Notes: Shot in the back by settlers during clashes that broke out after the settlers attacked a home in the village with stones. During the clashes, the settlers threw stones and fired live rounds at the residents, who threw stones in an attempt to repel them. Settlers killed two more Palestinians in the incident, including a minor, and wounded a father and his five-year-old daughter. In clashes that broke out in the village afterwards, soldiers killed another Palestinian. At least 11 more Palestinians were injured that day.

Name: 'Obadah Saed 'Awad Abu Srur
Notes: Shot in the back by settlers during clashes that broke out after the settlers attacked a home in the village with stones. During the clashes, the settlers threw stones and fired live rounds at the residents, who threw stones in an attempt to repel them. Settlers killed two more Palestinians in the incident, including a minor, and wounded a father and his five-year-old daughter. In clashes that broke out in the village afterwards, soldiers killed another Palestinian. At least 11 more Palestinians were injured that day.

Name: Kamel Mahmoud Kamel Abu Baker
Notes: Fatally shot by a Tel Aviv municipality security officer, after firing at him and his colleague, killing the colleague, during a street check. Israel is holding his body. Abu Baker was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Qusai Jamal Muhammad Mu'tan
Notes: Shot in the neck by settlers during clashes that erupted after the settlers invaded village lands.

Name: 'Abd al-Wahab 'Issa Hussein Khalaylah
Notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli civilian after running over and then stabbing passersby. According to media reports, Khalaylah injured eight Israeli civilians. He was shot at least two more times after being injured and falling to the ground. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhannad Falah 'Abdallah Shihadah
Notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli civilian after he and another Hamas military wing operative shot and wounded the settlement security guard, and then fired at Israeli civilians, killing four, including a minor, and wounding three others. The other operative was fatally shot a short while later by Special Police Unit officers after a chase. Israel is holding Shihadah’s body.

Name: 'Alaa Khalil 'Ali Qeisiyah
Notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli settler after entering the settlement’s limits and, according to the military, approaching settlers holding a knife. Israel held his body until 8 July 2023.

Name: 'Abd al-Karim Badi'a 'Abd al-Karim Sheikh
Notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli settler after, according to the military, he entered the settlement armed with knives and explosive devices. Israel held his body until 4 May 2023.

Name: Mithqal Suliman 'Abd al-Halim Rayan
Notes: Shot in the head by a settler while throwing stones with other young men at settlers, some of whom were armed, who approached residents’ homes and attacked one of the residents.

Name: Karam 'Ali Ahmad Salman
Notes: Fatally shot by settlement security guards when, according to the guards, he tried to enter the settlement. Israel held his body until 24 March 2023.

Name: Tareq 'Odeh Yusef M'aali
Notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli settler after trying to stab him in the agricultural outpost of Sde Efrayim. Israel held his body until 24 March 2023.

Name: Sanad Muhammad 'Othman Samamrah
Notes: Fatally shot by an Israeli settler near the outpost of Mitzpe Eshtamoa, while attacking another settler with a knife and, according to the media, moderately wounding him. Israel held his body until 3 April 2023.

Name: 'Udai Kamal Muhammad Musa Tamimi
Notes: Shot and killed by Ma’ale Adumim settlement security guards after he fired at them at the checkpoint at the entrance to the settlement and lightly wounded one of them. On 8 October 2022, Tamimi shot and killed a soldier at the Shu’fat R.C. checkpoint. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Ali Hassan Yusef Harb
Notes: Stabbed in the chest by a settler who invaded his family’s land along with other settlers in order to set up a structure there. Soldiers, police and settlers delayed his evacuation for about 15 minutes.

Name: Mu'tasem Muhammad Taleb 'Atallah
Notes: Fatally shot by a member of a settlement security squad after, according to the military, he entered the settlement’s territory holding a knife. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Nidal Jum'ah 'Abdallah Ja'afrah
Notes: Shot by an Israeli civilian after, according to the military, he stabbed another Israeli civilian with a screwdriver, seriously injuring him, during a bus ride. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Suliman 'Eid Yamin al-Hazalin
Notes: Critically wounded in his village by a tow truck the Israel Police was using to confiscate cars suspected of being unfit for use, after stones were thrown at it. According to the police, the truck driver sustained minor injuries. After hitting and injuring al-Hazalin, the tow truck dragged him along for nearly ten meters. Police officers and a soldier who were at the scene left after several minutes without providing al-Hazalin medical assistance or calling an ambulance. Since the injury, he has been lying in a coma in a hospital in Hebron.

Name: Khaled Maher Saleh Nofal
Notes: Fatally shot in the head and back by a settler and a settlement outpost security guard in circumstances unknown to B’Tselem. According to the military, he was unarmed. Israel held his body until 26 March 2021, when it was returned to his family.

Name: 'Ahed 'Abd a-Rahman Mahmoud Ekhlil
Notes: Wounded by a settlement security coordinator’s gunfire at Gush Etzion junction after, according to the military, he had thrown a knife during suspect apprehension procedure. Succumbed to his wounds shortly afterwards. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Mun'im Muhammad 'Abd al-Fatah
Notes: Critically injured by shots that two Israeli settlers fired as he crouched between dumpsters by Route 60, after he threw stones at cars on the road. According to one of the shooters, ‘Abd al-Fatah had also tried to knife the settler’s daughter who was in a car. The two settlers continued firing at ‘Abd al-Fatah as he lay wounded on the ground. Media reports stated that he later died in hospital in Israel. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Hamdi Taleb Sa'adah Na'asan
Notes: Hit in the back by settlers’ gunfire. He was with a group of village residents who were throwing stones at the settlers in an attempt to drive them off after the latter had come to the outskirts of the village and assaulted residents. Gunfire by the settlers injured another nine residents. Another villager was hit in the head by a rubber-coated metal bullet fired by Israeli security forces who arrived on the scene. Na’asan died of his injuries shortly after.

Name: 'Aishah Muhammad Talal Rabi
Notes: Killed by a stone thrown from the direction of the settlement Rechelim at the car she was riding in with her husband and daughter on Road 60.

Name: Muhammad Tareq Ibrahim Dar Yusef
Notes: Shot dead by a settler after he entered the settlement and stabbed three Israeli civilians; one was critically injured, succumbing to his wounds later that day. According to media reports the other two individuals sustained moderate and mild injuries. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Karim Zuhdi Marshud
Notes: Hit by shots a settler fired. According to the police he was shot after trying to stab another Israeli civilian with a screwdriver near a gas station at the entrance to the Mishor Adumim Industrial Zone.

Name: Hamzah Yusef Muhammad Zama'arah
Notes: Shot and killed by a security guard of the settlement of Carmei Tzur after stabbing another security guard at the entrance to the settlement. According to media reports, the other guard sustained minor injuries. The autopsy performed on Zama’arah showed he had been shot in the stomach, chest and back.

Name: Mahmoud Ahmad Zaa'l 'Odeh
Notes: Shot in the torso by a settler while on his own farmland in the village.

Name: Mu'taz Hussein Hilal Bani Shamsah
Notes: Shot to death by a settler who drove into the town of Huwara and found himself in the middle of a demonstration. After his car was blocked by an ambulance, the settler ran over several demonstrators, and other demonstrators began kicking his car and throwing stones at him. Video footage aired by the media shows the settler shooting through the back window of his car, with a military jeep close by, the demonstrators at a distance, and no real threat to his life. The shooting injured a press photographer; according to media reports, he sustained moderate injuries.

Name: Sa'ed Muhammad 'Ali Qeisiyah
Notes: According to media reports, he was fatally shot by a settler after he entered the settler’s home and stabbed him, inflicting mild injuries.

Name: Wael Yusef 'Abd a-Rahim Abu Saleh
Notes: Shot and killed by an Israeli civilian near the market in Netanya after he stabbed and wounded two Israelis. According to a statement by the Israel Police Spokesperson, one Israeli sustained moderate to severe wounds and the other sustained minor wounds.

Name: Muhammad Naser Mahmoud Tarayrah
Notes: Shot and killed by members of Kiryat Arba’s security detail, after he went into a home in the settlement and stabbed a teenaged Israeli girl to death in her bed. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Mahmoud 'Abd a-Rahman Raddad
Notes: Stabbed dead by an Israeli civilian, after he stabbed the civilian. According to a statement by the Israel Police Spokesperson, the civilian sustained moderate wounds.

Name: Hussein Muhammad Hussein Abu Ghosh
Notes: Shot dead by the settlement guard after stabbing, together with another Palestinian, two women, Israeli civilians. The other assailant was also shot dead. One of the injured women died of her wounds the next day. According to media reports, the other woman sustained moderate injuries.

Name: Ibrahim Ousamah Yusef 'Allan
Notes: Shot dead by the settlement guard after stabbing, together with another Palestinian, two women, Israeli civilians. The other assailant was also shot dead. One of the injured women died of her wounds the next day. According to media reports, the second woman sustained moderate injuries.

Name: Ruqayah 'Eid Muhammad Abu 'Eid
Notes: Shot dead by the settlement security guard after she tried to stab him.

Name: Muhammad Zahran 'Abd al-Halim Zahran
Notes: Shot dead by a security guard in the industrial zone after he stabbed her and another guard. Media reports stated that the female security guard sustained moderate injuries and the male security guard sustained to moderate to grave injuries.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Yusri Zakaria Maswdeh
Notes: Shot dead by the settlement’s head of security after stabbing a soldier and an Israeli civilian. Media reports stated that the civilian sustained light injuries and the soldier sustained light to moderate injuries.

Name: Fadi Muhammad Mahmoud Khasib
Notes: Shot dead by an Israeli civilian. According to the Israel Police Spokesperson, he was shot after he ran over two people waiting at a hitchhiking station, causing them light injuries, then got out of his car and ran at them wielding a knife.

Name: Shadi Muhammad Mahmoud Khasib
Notes: Shot dead by an Israeli civilian. According to the Israel Police Spokesperson, he was shot after trying to run over people waiting at a hitchhiking station, after which he got out of his car and stabbed one of them, injuring him lightly.

Name: Muhammad 'Abed Musa Nimer
Notes: Shot dead by a Jerusalem Light Rail security guard while attempting to stab him.

Name: Fadel Muhammad 'Awad al-Qawasmi
Notes: Shot dead by an Israeli civilian. According to a statement by the IDF Spokesperson, he was shot while attempting to stab the civilian.

Name: 'Alaa Dawood 'Ali Abu Jamal
Notes: Shot dead by passersby after he ran over people waiting at a bus stop and then stabbed an Israeli civilian to death. According to media reports, another three Israeli civilians were also injured in the assault, two sustaining moderate wounds.

Name: 'Ali Sa'ed Muhammad Dawabsheh
Notes: Killed when his house was torched. His parents and brother were seriously wounded in the fire. His father died of his wounds on 8 August 2015 and his mother succumbed on 7 September 2015. Hate graffiti in Hebrew was spray painted near his home.

Name: Sa'ed Muhammad Hassan Dawabsheh
Notes: Fatally wounded when his house was torched. His 18-month-old son was burnt to death and his wife and young son seriously wounded. His wife died of her wounds on 7 September 2015. Hate graffiti in Hebrew was spray painted near his home.

Name: Riham Hussein Hassan Dawabsheh
Notes: Fatally wounded when her house was torched. Her 18-month-old son was burnt to death. Her husband was fatally wounded and died of his wounds on 8 August 2015. Another young son was seriously wounded. Hate graffiti in Hebrew was spray painted near her home.

Name: Khaled 'Azmi Khaled 'Odeh
Notes: Shot by a settler driving along the Huwarah road where a protest march against the military’s actions in Operation Protective Edge was under way.

Name: Muhammad Hussein Sa'id Abu Khdeir
Notes: Abducted by three Israeli citizens – two of them minors. They took him to the Jerusalem Forest, where they beat him and burned him to death.

Name: Husam Hussein Muhammad a-Rawidi
Notes: Stabbed to death in the center of Jerusalem by a youth who lived in the city.

Name: Yusef Fakhri Musa Ekhlil
Notes: Killed by a settler, who shot him on Safa village land.

Name: 'Udai Maher Hamzah Qadus
Notes: Killed by a settler’s gunfire at the edge of the village after he apparently threw stones at the shooter.

Name: Samer Mahmoud Ahmad Sarhan
Notes: Killed by a security guard in Silwan, East Jerusalem.

Name: Aysar Yasser Fawaz Zarraqah
Notes: A settler shot him after he threw stones at the settler’s car, which was travelling on Route 60.

Name: Rabah Hijazi Muhammad Sidr
Notes: Killed by gunshots fired by a member of the settlement’s security detail after entering the settlement of Beit Hagai, south of Kiryat Arba, armed with a knife and wounding another member of the detail in the leg.

Name: 'Alaa Hashem Hussein Abu Dheim
Notes: Killed when he entered Mercaz Harav Yeshiva and fired at the students.

Name: Muhammad Saleh Saber Shreiteh
Notes: Killed while throwing stones at a buys in a demonstration of youths.

Name: Muhammad Fathi Yunes Sabarneh
Notes: Killed by gunfire of teachers in a yeshiva after he entered the yeshiva area with another armed person and stabbed the instructors.

Name: Mahmoud Khalil 'Abd al-Fatah Sabarneh
Notes: Killed by gunfire of teachers in a yeshiva after he entered the yeshiva area with another armed person and stabbed the instructors.

Name: Taysir Yasser 'Abd al-Karim al-Karki
Notes: Taxi driver. Stabbed in the flat of his passenger, Julian Sophier, whom he had driven from Jerusalem. He had gone to the flat to get paid for the ride.

Name: Ahmad 'Ali Hassan Mansur
Notes: Killed in a shooting attack in the factory where he worked.

Name: Khalil Muhammad Ra'uf Saleh Wleiwel
Notes: Killed in a shooting attack in the factory where he worked.

Name: Ousamah Musa Ahmad 'Odeh Tawafshah
Notes: Killed in a shooting attack in the factory where he worked.

Name: Bassam Musa Ahmad 'Odeh Tawafshah
Notes: Killed in a shooting attack in the factory where he worked.

Name: Tareq Suliman 'Abdallah Yasin
Notes: Killed while carrying out a shooting attack. Two Israeli civilians were killed and three others were wounded in the attack

Name: Mahyoub Ahmad Nimer 'Asi
Notes: Killed by a Separation Barrier security guard, while he was in the family plot, about 200 meters away from a bulldozer parking lot.

Name: 'Alaa Muhammad 'Abd a-Rahman Khalil
Notes: Killed while throwing stones at an Israeli vehicle driven by private security guards the Separation Barrier.

Name: Salman Yusef Salman a-Safdi
Notes: Killed by a settler after he penetrated his house. He was not armed.

Name: Saeil Mustafa Ahmad Jbarah
Notes: Killed while driving his taxi, by a settler who wanted him to stop.

Name: Rayik Ma'sud Daraghmeh
Notes: Killed by the settlement security officer after he went into a field to relieve himself.

Name: Mahmoud Amin Mahmoud Hanani
Notes: Killed by settler gunfire while attempting to attack the settlement.

Name: Azher Ghassan Fawaz Hanani
Notes: Killed by a settler gunfire after trying to infiltrate the settlement when armed.

Name: Ahmad 'Abd a-Rahman Subuh
Notes: Killed when he went into a field to relieve himself.

Name: Tareq Abu Sneineh
Notes: Killed by settler gunfire after he fired at Nethaniel Ozeri, near Hebron.

Name: Hazem 'Adnan Fanun
Notes: Killed when guards returned fire at an unknown source.

Name: Isma'il Brreis 'Ashur
Notes: Killed by the settlement security officer after shooting two Israelis.

Name: Khaled Abu al-Iz
Notes: Killed by guards of the Trans-Israel Highway after he fired at men working on the highway.

Name: Hani Bani Maniyah
Notes: Shot and killed by settlers while harvesting his olives.

Name: Yusef Ibrahim Hassan 'Atallah
Notes: Killed by the security settlement unit after he infiltrated the settlement and wounded two people.

Name: Nivin Jamjum
Notes: Killed by gunfire when settlers rioted in Hebron.

Name: 'Adnan 'Odeh
Notes: Killed by gunfire when settlers rioted in Huwarra.

Name: Muhannad Mahmoud Abu Zor
Notes: Killed after entering a settlement and opening fire

Name: Habash Samir Abu a-So'ud Hanani
Notes: Shot and killed by an Israeli civilian after he entered the settlement of Itamar, opened fire and killed three Israeli civilians.

Name: 'Ali Idris Hamdan
Notes: Killed by the security officer after he penetrated the settlement and wounded the security officer in the neck.

Name: 'Issa Mahmoud Salim
Notes: Killed by gunfire from an ambush while riding in a truck near the settlement.

Name: 'Ata 'Abd al-Hai
Notes: Killed by gunfire from an ambush while riding in a truck near the settlement.

Name: Muhammad 'Awad
Notes: Killed by the settlement's security office after he infiltrated the settlement and killed a soldier.

Name: Muhammad Tawfiq 'Awadallah a-Shamali
Notes: Killed by settlers while attempting to commit a suicide attack in the Efrat settlement.

Name: Jamil Muhammad Abu 'Adwan
Notes: Killed by an Israeli civilian after firing at him and severely wounding him.

Name: Ibrahim Nabulsi
Notes: Killed by the security guard at a bank in East Jerusalem.

Name: Haydar Jadu' 'Abd al-Jabber Kan'an
Notes: Killed while riding in his car.

Name: Diaa' Marwan a-Tmeizi
Notes: Killed in a shooting attack by settlers when she was riding in her father's car.

Name: Muhammad Salamah a-Tmeizi
Notes: Killed in an attack by settlers while he was driving in his car.

Name: Muhammad Helmi a-Tmeizi
Notes: Killed in an attack by settlers while he was driving in his car.

Name: 'Awni 'Ali Hadad
Notes: Killed by Israelis who shot him while he was driving his truck with his family inside.

Name: Najib Muhammad Muhammad 'Abido
Notes: Killed after he infiltrated a settlement. He was shot by a settler when he tried to attack a police officer.

Name: Muhammad Hamed 'Ali Shalash
Notes: Killed by settler gunfire when throwing stones at their car.

Name: Muhammad Judah Abu 'Aasi
Notes: Killed by an Israeli civilian after he had stabbed his employer.

Name: Mustafa Mahmoud Musa 'Alian
Notes: Killed as a result of being hit in the chest by a rock when settlers threw stones at a car he was riding in.

Name: Farid Musa 'Issa a-Nesasreh
Notes: Killed by a settler from Itamar while harvesting olives near the settlement.

Name: Fahed Mustafa 'Odeh Baker
Notes: Killed by settlers who rioted in Biddya village.
